item.content:encoded:
The race to provide crypto services is on! Yesterday, we reported on Cash App unveiling three crypto services and today, similar news has turned up for Mastercard. Payment giants are now openly embracing crypto with open arms and seem to have gotten over their hesitance. This time, the global payment titan Mastercard has filled 15 new trademark applications all related to crypto services including fintech and metaverse technologies. Although the initial debut might take some time, here‚Äôs a good rumor you can buy and sell it while the news gets out.

Crypto Services on Mastercard

Let‚Äôs face it, we will all live and breathe in metaverse in the years to come. Even if that may not be true, Mastercard is totally not going to miss out on payment services inside the virtual world of our promising future. Hence, the 15 trademark applications all indicate Mastercard is onboard the NFT- Metaverse train.

According to top trademark lawyer Mike Kondoudis, the recent request is indicative of plans to create NFT-backed media as well as a payment processing and e-commerce transaction system in the metaverse. And since that is not done to death, a marketplace for crypto assets seems to be on the way.

The crypto services include trademarks for downloadable multimedia files containing video, text, artwork and audio verified by NFTs and e-commerce software. The software at hand will operate within the metaverse to handle electronic business transactions.

But fear not, there will be virtual credit cards and debit cards in the metaverse for you to over-spend with. Master card will process payments using these cards in metaverse.

What Happens in Metaverse‚Ä¶

According to Kondoudis, Mastercard has also filed trademarks for events and performances in the metaverse. Furthermore, they have applied to create online communities related to digital assets.

Interestingly, Kondoudis has also found the number of NFT trademarks to be skyrocketing as compare with last year. In fact, the trademarks so far (Q1, 2022) have surpassed the total number of last year. As of April 2022, about 1,967 applications have been submitted while the total number for 2021 has been 1,965.

Mastercard revealed plans this year to create an NFT marketplace in association with exchange platform Coinbase. The marketplace will go live sometime in the future and will support Mastercard debit and credit cards for payments.

Mastercard and Bakkt

The announcement made on October 25, had a promise of quick and easy access to cryptocurrency services.

According to the statements, ‚ÄúMastercard customers can now enable consumers to buy, sell and hold cryptocurrency, deliver unique, crypto-centric loyalty opportunities, and streamline issuance of branded crypto debit and credit cards‚Äù.

Bakkt is a digital asset platform that provides both services and solutions for customers. The integration of services in Mastercard ecosystem will be beneficial for both parties.

Bullish on Bakkt

Following the news, BKKT, had an incredible 240% rally in only five days. A testament to the open arms of the public to crypto adoption.

The company was found in 2018 by Gavin Michael, a prominent crypto personality. As a previous Coinbase investor and a New York Stock Exchange owner, Michael is as seasoned as a CEO can get.

‚ÄúWe‚Äôre lowering the barriers to entry, allowing people to take something like your rewards points and trade them into crypto. It‚Äôs an easy way to get going because you‚Äôre not using cash, you‚Äôre putting something that‚Äôs an idle asset sitting on your balance sheet, and we‚Äôre allowing you to put in to work.‚Äù Said Bakkt in an interview with CNBC.

It seems that the cryptocurrency adoption is picking up pace. Considering the warnings of hyperinflation and the institutions hedging against it with Bitcoin, it is a first come first serve situation.

Large companies are now inclined to join the race of crypto adoption since the market favors those who came first. Although a bit unrelated, Walmart installing Bitcoin ATMs is another example of this phenomenon. Furthermore, the Bitcoin ETF rollout in the US stock exchange was another example of the huge capacity and appeal for crypto investment.

We are at a critical point in history when giants are racing to invest in cryptocurrencies. In that regard, the market has an extremely bullish outlook.
